item.title: 8 Best Strategy Games That Encourage Multiple Approaches
item.description:
Summary

  • Some strategy games offer a variety of approaches to keep gameplay fresh.
  • Balatro is a roguelike deck-builder with diverse strategies and synergies.
  • Dune: Spice Wars provides multiple victory conditions and bold strategies.

The strategy game genre is one that is broad and diverse, offering an array of experiences that vary wildly in complexity and challenge. However, some of these titles can feel like there's only ever one solution to any given situation, and when this solution becomes obvious, it can suck the fun out of the game.

Some strategy games, however, attempt to circumvent this design problem by offering players a tremendous number of approaches to take. Games such as Kenshi offer basic combat but champion player agency by providing a great number of options. Meanwhile, titles such as Dune: Spice Wars provide multiple approaches in the form of numerous victory conditions.

8 Balatro

A Deck-Builder With A Variety Of Unique Passive Items

Arguably one of the most accessible roguelike deck-builders, Balatro remains a strategic game through its diverse variety of potential strategies and synergies. Each run is made unique by giving the player a choice of starting decks, and this is only elevated by the random Jokers (passive upgrades) and distinct cards that can be acquired and even upgraded throughout each run.

Balatro can begin to feel somewhat repetitive due to the simplicity of its moment-to-moment gameplay, a loop that's heavily based on Poker and score-attack games. However, the diversity of available strategies ensures the game remains fresh for a good while.

7 Mount & Blade: Warband

A Strategic Sandbox With Dynamic Real-Time Battles

Mount & Blade: Warband may be a little rough around the edges, but it makes up for it in spades with its unique gameplay and variety of strategic approaches. In the game, players take command of their own army, working their reputation with the in-game factions and participating in near-constant conflict.

The RPG elements of the game, as well as the variety of army units, help to keep Mount & Blade a diverse experience. However, this is further elevated by the dynamic real-time battles, during which players can use commands to maneuver their army into strategic positions, potentially changing the course of a battle.

6 Darkest Dungeon

Turn-Based Strategy With Multiple Character Classes & Unique Items

This dark, Gothic turn-based strategy game is a harsh and unforgiving experience that not only offers multiple strategies, but encourages them. In Darkest Dungeon , players are given the task of managing a roster of not-so-stalwart adventurers and sending them into dangerous dungeons populated by Lovecraftian horrors.

The end goal is to rid the land of these creatures, but the journey is a long and arduous one. Thankfully, the experience is packed with variety; not only are there a multitude of character classes, but each has multiple ability options and can even be equipped with a variety of unique items. Furthermore, only four adventurers can go on any given mission, meaning that players must frequently switch up their party and experiment with different strategies.

5 Kenshi

A Sandbox RPG With Strategic Combat

Although Kenshi's combat is relatively basic, the real-time strategy, tactical pause feature, and squad dynamics keep it an engaging experience. However, the multiple approaches present in Kenshi's design take place outside of combat, in preparation and progression.

Kenshi is a sandbox RPG that champions player agency at every turn, allowing them to play the game at their own pace and set their own goals. There's a diverse variety of ways to build any given character in Kenshi , and there are a multitude of activities to focus on. Overall, this results in an experience that's consistently rewarding, as players are encouraged to experiment and follow the path that suits them best.

4 Super Auto Pets

An Auto-Battler With Tremendous Variety

Super Auto Pets is an accessible auto-battler with a truly elegant design that combines elements of traditional auto-battlers and games such as Hearthstone . This results in a loop that's both simple and strategic, elevated by a truly diverse set of potential strategies and synergies.

In the game, players are given the task of building a small squad of pets, buffing them with unique items and doing battle in asynchronous multiplayer. The variety of pets and items, as well as the randomization within its gameplay, typically result in unique squads each match. Optimal strategies do pop up, but the game's weekly mode switches up the roster of available pets and items on a regular basis, helping to keep the experience fresh.

3 Wildfrost

A Roguelike Deck-Builder With Multiple Factions

This charming roguelike deck-builder features a unique twist, tasking players with building a party of adventurers and managing their turn timers in battle. A variety of status effects, card types, and companions also help to inject some variety into the gameplay, along with a unique charm system that helps players to gear party members toward a specific strategy.

What allows Wildfrost to support such a wide variety of approaches, however, is its array of playable factions. Each of these three unique groups offer their own distinctive play-styles and a variety of strategies within, allowing players to take a different approach near every run.

2 Dune: Imperium

Deck-Building Strategy With A Variety Of Options

  • Platform(s): PC, Xbox, Mobile
  • Released: March 13, 2024
  • Developer(s): Dire Wolf
  • Publisher : Dire Wolf
  • Genre: Board Game

Dune: Imperium is a tremendous and complex board game superbly adapted by Dire Wolf for the digital format and supported by a slick user-interface. Mechanically dense and yet easy to learn, Dune: Imperium is a deck-building game with a worker-placement structure, giving players a wealth of choice in both how to build their deck and how to use it.

Dune: Imperium is fleshed out with a wide array of cards that can be added to any given deck, and many of these cards have multiple uses. Combined with the diverse ensemble of leader characters, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, Dune: Imperium offers a tremendous number of strategic approaches.

1 Dune: Spice Wars

A 4X RTS With Multiple Victory Conditions

Combining elements of both the 4X and real-time strategy genres, Dune: Spice Wars is a unique beast that elevates itself with thematic mechanics that tie in with its legendary source material. Despite featuring gameplay that's simplified in certain regards, Dune: Spice Wars remains mechanically deep through a series of systems, each of which offer players a variety of bold strategies. Furthermore, the game can be won in a variety of ways.

Taking place on the harsh desert world of Arrakis, Dune: Spice Wars takes full advantage of its hostile environment by working it into the gameplay. Attrition is a very real problem for any player's armies, as well as the infamous sandworms. In keeping with the source material, politics and espionage are also integral to the design of Dune: Spice Wars , further adding to the dense landscape of strategies. Best of all, Dune: Spice Wars features a variety of playable factions that each offer their own play-styles and a set of advisors to choose from. Each of these factions plays dramatically differently from one another, resulting in a multitude of approaches.

item.title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Player Discovers Useful Skip at the Start of the DLC
item.description:
Summary

  • A player found a handy skip to reach Scadu Altus in the Elden Ring DLC quickly.
  • Fans speculate on the methods speedrunners use to discover these obscure skips while also showing interest in this shortcut being used by speedrunners.

An Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree player has found a handy skip at the start of the DLC that can quickly take them to Scadu Altus. While that area itself is not terribly far away, the path is filled with dangerous enemies, so this can help players reach the area within a matter of seconds after starting the Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.

It's been close to six months since Shadow of the Erdtree DLC launched, and the game is still shattering records. FromSoftware revealed Elden Ring 's final sales number, stating that it sold a whopping 28 million units since launch. Recently, FromSoftware also announced a new game set in the same universe, Elden Ring: Nightreign , which instilled a lot of excitement throughout the community.

In a new post on the Elden Ring subreddit, user GPdevotion reveals an interesting path that many might've missed. They pointed to a faster way to reach Scadu Altus after entering the Lands Between which involves using the gravestone wall near the Church of Consolation in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. The crafty Redditor showcases a series of nerve-wracking jumps with Torrent, allowing them to traverse cliff. Ideally, these gravestone cliffs only allow players to go down and not up, but this trick involves jumping on rocks in between to make the skip possible.

Elden Ring Fans Ponder How Speedrun Glitches Are Found

A few Redditors mentioned that some speedrunners used this trick to reach Scadu Altus in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, which has sparked a debate in the community. Many are intrigued about how players find routes like this, considering their obscure nature. While some believe that it just merely trial and error, others think it also involves looking at the game's files to find areas that can be exploited for such skips. In reality, it's likely to be a combination of both.

This is not the only case where players found something new in Elden Ring recently. For instance, one player discovered a method for defeating Margit in Elden Ring that was previously believed to be impossible, which involved making him fall off the cliff where his fight takes place. The fact that players continue to discover things in both the base game and expansion so many months after their respective launches is a testament to the community's dedication.

item.title: 7 Days To Die: How To Complete Infested Clear Missions (And Why They Are Worth Doing)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Start An Infested Clear Mission
  • Completing An Infested Clear Mission
  • Infested Clear Mission Rewards

There are a few different mission types that players can choose to complete in 7 Days To Die. Some, like buried treasure missions, are pretty straightforward. However, there are some jobs that are incredibly tough to complete. As you progress through the trader tiers, you'll unlock tougher missions. Some of the toughest missions in the game are infested missions. Players can opt to charge into a building filled with all sorts of undead enemies and take them all out.

These missions, while challenging, are excellent for gaining XP, farming loot, and getting hold of some good and sometimes rare rewards. This guide will go through all there is to know about completing infested missions in 7 Days To Die.

How To Start An Infested Clear Mission

To start any mission, you'll need to pay a trader a visit. On a standard map, there are 5 different traders; Rekt, Jen, Bob, Hugh, and Joe. For the most part, it doesn't really matter which trader you speak to. The things that do matter are the mission location and the mission tier. The higher the mission tier, the more difficult the mission. Also, the biome where the mission takes place plays a role in how tough the enemies will be. For example, a mission completed in the forest is far less likely to have lots of ferals when compared to a mission that takes place in the Wasteland.

Infested missions can be started after you have unlocked tier 2 missions. To unlock tier 2 missions, you'll need to complete a total of 10 tier 1 missions. Infested clear missions are considerably harder than standard clear missions. You can expect to come up against more zombies than normal. Not only that, but the zombies tend to be tougher zombies, like radiated zombies, cops, and ferals. Tier 6 infested clear missions are by far the most difficult missions in the game. However, by the time you have gained access to tier 6 missions, you should be well-armed and ready to take them on. No matter what tier the mission is, the objective for infested clear missions remains the same; eliminate all enemies within a certain area.

Completing An Infested Clear Mission

Once you have arrived at the POI (point of interest) where the mission takes place, you'll need to activate it by interacting with the marker in front of the building/area. Activating this marker means that you can't leave the area. If you stray too far from the POI, then the mission will fail. Also, if you die during the mission, this will cause you to spawn outside the mission area, meaning that if you die, you fail the mission.

Every location in the game wants players to go a certain way. Inside each POI there are several trigger points. A trigger point is an event that takes place once the player crosses a certain threshold within a POI. This can be anything from the floor collapsing to a horde of zombies jumping in from above. To avoid this, take an alternative route through the POI. The way that the game wants you to go is usually lit up by torches, lanterns, or any other type of lighting. If you avoid following the designated path, then you'll also avoid accidentally triggering a dangerous trap.

One helpful tip when clearing dangerous locations is to always carry a handful of building blocks. That way, if you ever fall into a trap, you can quickly build your way out of it. Also, you can use the blocks to hop up the side of a building, avoiding the main path, and allowing you to take the zombies by surprise.

When it comes to any clear mission, as soon as a zombie has been activated, it will appear as a red dot at the top of the screen. The larger the red dot, the closer the zombie is to you. Using this, it's possible to keep track of the zombie's rough location, preventing you from getting overrun.

As for killing the zombies, just like almost every other zombie-based video game, the head is their weak point. While a few cracks to the head are usually enough to take down most enemies, there are a few with special abilities that are worth keeping an eye out for:

Zombie Type

Abilities

How To Handle Them

Cops

Spit toxic vomit and explode when injured

Cops typically throw their heads back prior to spitting the toxic vomit. Use this time to find cover. Try to always keep some distance to avoid being in a cop's blast zone.

Spiders

Jump across large distances

Listen for the screeching sound. They make this sound right before they jump. Once they are near, get in a few quick headshots

Screamers

Scream to summon other zombies

Prioritize killing these over other zombie types to prevent being overrun by lots of zombies.

Demolition Zombies

Have a glowing explosive package taped to their chest

Don't hit their chest. If you do, the explosive will begin to beep. Should this happen, run as far away as possible.

When you get to the final room during an infested clear mission, you'll see lots of top-tier loot containers. While you are going to want to search all of the containers, you should also be careful. Most infested clear missions save the largest number of zombies for the loot room. Once you step inside, there's a high chance that you'll be swamped by zombies. Before going into the loot room/area, make sure that you are fully healed, your weapons are durable and reloaded, and that you know your way out. One key rule for survival is to always know your existence. If things get too dangerous, you'll need to get out, fast.

Once you have cleared all of the zombies, your mission objective will change, and you'll need to report back to the trader to claim your reward. Before leaving, be sure to grab all of the valuable loot from the final room. One big difference between a regular clear mission and an infested clear mission is the loot. On top of the standard loot crates, you'll find an infested cache. This box usually contains enough ammo, magazines, and other quality items to make the mission worthwhile.

Infested Clear Mission Rewards

Once you have returned to the trader, you'll be able to choose a reward. The reward you get is random. However, the quality/rarity of the rewards available depends on a few factors:

  • Game Stage
  • Loot Stage
  • Tier Selection
  • Skillpoint Selection

Your game stage goes up naturally while you play. While the same is true for your loot stage, there are a few things you can do to boost it. Lucky Looter is a skill that helps to bump up your loot stage. There's also the treasure hunter's mod that further increases it. As for your tier selection, the higher the mission tier, the better the rewards.

The final thing you can do to get the best rewards is invest points into the perk A Daring Adventurer. This increases the number of Dukes you get for completing missions. Also, at rank 4, this perk allows the player to select two rewards instead of one upon completing a mission. This is a real must-have perk for those who enjoy completing missions. The extra Dukes are a huge help. However, being able to grab two rewards can be incredibly beneficial, especially if they are rare rewards such as solar cells, crucibles, or legendary parts.

After you've claimed your rewards, it's always a good idea to sell any unwanted items you picked up during the mission to the trader. Each Duke you make in a sale gives you 1XP. While it doesn't seem like much, if you sell items in large quantities, it's possible to get thousands of XP with just the click of a button.

item.title: Every Borderlands Vault Hunter's Status Ahead of BL4
item.description:
Summary

  • Some Borderlands Vault Hunters won't return in BL4, with deaths and short-lived appearances.
  • Popular past characters like Lilith and Zer0 are confirmed alive for Borderlands 4.
  • The series has accumulated 20 playable Vault Hunters across the main games, though it's unclear which will return besides Zane.

One could argue that Borderlands games live and die by their roster of playable Vault Hunters and the quality of the loot, as those can be the most appealing bits of new games and what drives the hype - and Borderlands 4 is likely to be no different. In fact, Borderlands 4 's Vault Hunters already received backlash for what some fans described as "bland design," further showing how iconic the four playable characters (not counting DLC Vault Hunters) can be for the series. With four main games preceding Borderlands 4 , now is a good time to look back and see where each of these playable characters is.

Not all Borderlands Vault Hunters survived the events of the series, and those who didn't are extremely unlikely to return in Borderlands 4 , if not in flashbacks or maybe even lookalike NPCs. Borderlands can be a whacky series when it comes to its story and humor, so it's not impossible to see familiar faces in some shape or form in Borderlands 4 - and some of them have already been confirmed by the recent trailer. So far, the series has amassed a total of 20 playable Vault Hunters divided as follows:

  • 4 in Borderlands
  • 6 in Borderlands 2
  • 6 in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
  • 4 in Borderlands 3

The Whereabouts of Every Playable Borderlands Vault Hunter Explained

Roland

Roland is one of the various playable Vault Hunters in Borderlands games that died. Shot by Handsome Jack in Borderlands 2 , Roland's death was the catalyst for some key events in the series, but he is unlikely to be seen again in the future.

Brick

Alongside other recurring characters within the series, Brick is in Borderlands 3 , albeit in a small role mainly dedicated to one story mission and some side quests. Still, he is currently alive and presumably spends time with Mordecai and Tiny Tina.

Mordecai

Similar to Brick, Mordecai returned in Borderlands 3 for a short time. He tragically lost his trusted companion, Bloodwing, in the events of Borderlands 2 , and then came back in BL3 with a new pet of the same species called Talon. Both Mordecai and Talon are alive.

Lilith

Initially presumed dead after the events of Borderlands 3 , Lilith is alive ahead of Borderlands 4 and will likely still play a huge part in the events of the game. It's unclear if her human form has been changed after the end of BL3 , but she is bound to make an appearance in the sequel.

The Whereabouts of Every Playable Borderlands 2 Vault Hunter Explained

Axton

Not much is known about Axton after the events of Borderlands 2 , but he does come back in Borderlands 3 's Arms Race DLC as a commentator for the reality show-like game mode. He is alive ahead of Borderlands 4 .

Salvador

In the same spot as Axton is Borderlands 2 's Salvador. Another of the main four Vault Hunters in the game, Salvador shares the stage with Axton in Borderlands 3 as an ECHO caster in the Arms Race DLC, and is currently alive.

Zer0

Zer0's role in Borderlands 3 is not as small as other recurring characters, and he is involved with the Maliwan vs. Atlas plotline. Despite the boss fight eerily resembling Zer0 in BL3 , he is alive and still serves under Atlas.

Maya

Maya died in Borderlands 3 in what some fans label as Ava's fault. Ava is a Siren in training in Borderlands 3 , and she inherits Maya's powers after the Calipso Twins are defeated. Since Maya met her demise, she most likely won't be seen in Borderlands 4.

Gaige

The first DLC Vault Hunter in Borderlands games alongside Krieg, Gaige came back in Borderlands 3 for the Guns, Love, and Tentacles DLC. Like most past Vault Hunters who came back in BL3 , she is alive at the end of the DLC.

Krieg

The playable Psycho Krieg got his own DLC in Borderlands 3 , which is dedicated to him dealing with the aftermath of Maya's death. With the sad and yet humorous nature of the DLC, Krieg is still alive at the end of it.

The Whereabouts of Every Playable Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel Vault Hunter Explained

Athena

Though Athena is tied to Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel 's infamous The Watcher's war, she is never seen again in mainline games. If spin-offs are anything to go by, Athena is a CEO in New Tales From The Borderlands , and she is presumably alive.

Wilhelm

It may not come as a surprise to fans that Wilhelm died in Borderlands 2 , with Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel explaining his rise to power within Hyperion as a Handsome Jack loyalist. As such, he is likely not returning in the next game.

Nisha

In the same vein as Wilhelm, Nisha is one of Borderlands 2 's bosses, and she can be killed in an optional mission. As such, her status as a playable Vault Hunter in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel was always meant to be short-lived.

Claptrap

Perhaps the most notorious Borderlands character is Claptrap, who to many fans' joy became playable in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel . Much like the cover Psycho, Claptrap is Borderlands ' mascot and is very much alive.

Timothy

Known as Jack's Doppelganger in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel , Timothy returns in Borderlands 3 's DLC Moxxi's Heist of the Handsome Jackpot. He is a supportive character in the DLC, and is still alive when it concludes.

Aurelia

Sister to Borderlands ' Sir Hammerlock, Aurelia Hammerlock meets her demise in a boss fight in Borderlands 3 after siding with the Calispo Twins. She is dead before the events of BL4 and won't likely return.

The Whereabouts of Every Playable Borderlands 3 Vault Hunter Explained

Zane

Zane is confirmed to be back in Borderlands 4 , as he is shown in the recent trailer alive and well, albeit aged up a little. It's unclear what role he will play in the story, though.

Amara

Not much is known about Amara after the events of Borderlands 3 , and it's currently impossible to tell if she will be back in Borderlands 4 . However, she was alive by the end of BL3 .

FL4K

One of the most beloved Vault Hunters in the series, FL4K is the robot beastmaster from Borderlands 3 . Much like Amara, their whereabouts between the events of BL3 and BL4 are unknown, but they are presumed alive.

Moze

Last but not least, Moze shares the same fate as Amara and FL4K, as she was playable in Borderlands 3 and her current status is unknown. She is presumably alive, though that doesn't necessarily mean she will be back for the sequel.

item.title: 24 Fun Online Games To Make Friends
item.description:
Summary

  • Online games offer the opportunity to make new virtual friends from around the globe through cooperative gameplay.
  • Joining clans, communicating via voice chat, and teaming up in online games can lead to strong relationships with fellow players.
  • Despite toxic players, many online gaming communities are welcoming and friendly, providing a positive environment to make friendships.

Thankfully there are plenty of fun and immersive games online that can help both beginner and more experienced players make some new virtual friends. From fantasy, sim, and action to FPS online games players can get lost in all kinds of thrilling worlds while making friends and improving their gaming skills.

In some of these games, players can join clans and meet lots of people at once and get guidance or simply have some fun together. However, there are some excellent options for introverts too who prefer to play and communicate with only one other gamer. They can too find breathtaking online open-world games and sharpen their gaming skills during online co-op adventures. Unfortunately, there are quite a few gamers who have to deal with toxic players online, but there are also plenty of really chill and kind players and communities who are always welcoming toward newbies.

Updated on December 22, 2024, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Online games are more than just a hobby to have some fun in. Thanks to voice chat support in most multiplayer games, they are now a means of communication and hanging out with friends, especially in MMO games where virtual hangout exists!

The social features in multiplayer games sometimes move one step forward and become a hub to find new friends. It's happened to a lot of gamers that they have a come across a nice person in an online game, and they have stuck together for a long time.

24 Escape From Tarkov

Brutal Environment Makes Friendship More Valuable Than Ever

Escape From Tarkov is quite an unforgiving shooter experience, as a single bullet in the right spot will guarantee a kill. It requires a lot of focus and dedication to collect the right equipment and put them to good use. So, it's safe to say that the game has a really long learning curve.

The players, however, can randomly join other players if they want to, and this is a big opportunity to find some great friends who have each other's backs in challenging situations. Even without joining someone in matchmaking, the proximity voice chat will allow the player to talk to strangers on the map, and who knows, maybe a good soul is there!

23 Rocket League

Successive Collaborations Between Good Teammates Can Lead To Permanent Kinship

Rocket League burst onto the scene as one of the most popular sports video games around, combining high-speed vehicles with soccer to make for a winning combination. Sure, there are other game modes, but it was the first formula that continues to enrapture players to this day.

The sheer amount of fun players can have in Rocket League when they have a good team can't be stated enough. If two player are perfect in different roles and understand how their strengths complement each other, then it's prudent to play more games together to make the most of this title.

22 Arma Reforger

Team-Based Tactical Shooter Where Communication Is Inevitable

Arma Reforger serves more like a portal from Arma 3 to Arma 4 , but it is also a great multiplayer experience, especially for those who have a love for realistic military shooters. The gameplay system in Reforger is deep and the more the player works with it the more they will learn the hidden mechanics and tactical elements.

Since Arma Reforger is not the game to be a one-man-army in, it is important to coordinate with the squad-mates, follow the orders, and let the squad leader know about everything happening on the battlefield. Arma Reforger is a great game to make not one, but loads of friends and have fun with them playing the game.

21 Minecraft

Various Servers That House Players Willing To Make Friends

Minecraft is one of the biggest indie games of all time. It takes something really special for a game to reinvent a genre, spawn multiple clones that try to imitate its success and attract the attention of a billion-dollar company that paid a truckload of money to gain exclusive rights to this game.

The sheer amount of creativity in this game is evident in the many servers that exist for players to check out. It's easy to find other players to spend some time with. The carefree nature of the game makes it easy to have fun with other players, although older players should know that the majority of players in this game are pretty young.

20 Rust

The Organic Gameplay Moments People Experience With Other Players Makes For A Great Time

Players who love survival video games should check out Rust because this online multiplayer will transport them into a harsh but beautiful post-apocalyptic world where they'll have to rely not only on their survival but also on their communication and team-playing skills.

During their adventures players will have to gather resources, build shelters, as well as form alliances and join clans to make sure they can survive Rust's harsh world. As players cooperate, they'll have to make smart strategic decisions and help each other survive and explore this fascinating but intense gaming world.

19 Valorant

Coordinating With A Squad And Winning Matches Makes For A Great Bonding Experience

Riot Games' Valorant is one of the most colorful and action-packed online games that help players make new friends from all over the globe. This tactical FPS allows players to choose from a wide variety of Agents all with their own unique abilities and then work together with their teammates while using their abilities in harmony to defeat their enemies.

While it's a challenging game that can be difficult for beginners it's also a highly entertaining one that also makes sure that players will be able to bond and build relationships with each other as they build and improve their team together.

18 League Of Legends

Despite The Community's Toxicity, It's Not Impossible To Form Valuable Bonds With Good Teammates

League of Legends has one of the most passionate global communities with players of all levels which makes this online game one of the best options for both beginner and avid gamers. Players will be able to choose from some of the best League of Legends skins before exploring its world-famous battle arenas.

This popular MOBA allows players to connect and learn how to communicate more effectively during battles and eventually form strong bonds. Since players can also choose from an excellent selection of champions with unique abilities and looks they can easily find one that fits their play-style and personality.

17 Deadlock

The New Shooter MOBA In The Making From Valve

Although Deadlock is not fully out yet, a large number of players have already received access to it, and the game is constantly making progress with feedback from players. Deadlock combines the core elements of a third-person hero-shooter with MOBA and the result is a quite satisfying experience.

Playing Deadlock requires an invitation at this moment. Someone who already has access to the game can invite others.

Thankfully, the Deadlock community is not as toxic as other competitive games, at least not yet. That opens up the opportunity to have a positive experience with random wholesome teammates who try to help and remain positive regardless of winning or losing.

16 Overwatch 2

A Squad That Clicks Can Form Long-Lasting Bonds For Years To Come

Overwatch is an action-packed team-based online shooter with millions of players from all over the globe. Even though it's a highly competitive game it's a great choice for beginners too since they'll be able to meet players of all levels and types and not only share a fantastic experience but learn from each other.

Players will be able to choose from a fine variety of heroes and strategize with their teammates before, during, and after each battle to make sure the team can perform its best. Overwatch is a great choice for players who love fast-paced online games that'll help them improve their communication and gaming skills while also allowing them to make new friends.

15 Elden Ring

Cooperating With Other Tarnished Ones To Take Out Powerful Bosses Makes For A Great Time

Elden Ring is one of the toughest dark fantasy RPGs that's still more fun than frustrating thanks to the highly welcoming and large community the game has. Elden Ring has one of the kindest online communities where most players are understanding and helpful toward newbies as well.

Most Elden Ring fans embark on their journeys to enjoy the game's stunning visuals and deep lore and mythology and are happy to share their experiences with others. So, while Elden Ring is a difficult game, beginners and casual gamers can use the easy mode and can get plenty of help from other players and even build new friendships while going on unforgettable adventures.

14 Hell Let Loose

Work With The Squad Leader And Obey The Commands To Achieve Victory

Hell Let Loose is a large-scale tactical shooter where communication is key to success. And where there is communication, there can be friendships too. Each player is assigned to a squad, where they should contact the squad leader and receive orders from them. The squad leaders themselves, though, receive orders from the commander, who is usually an overly experienced player.

Most Hell Let Loose servers kick players for not communicating or not having a microphone. So, the player has to actively report about their position and the situation they are facing, and this creates some magnificent friendships within squads, which encourages them to play again and again.

13 Stardew Valley

A Cozy Game With Co-op Support Where Two Strangers Can Become Steadfast Friends In No Time

Stardew Valley is one of the best online games to make new friends for gamers and complete newbies too. Since it's a wholesome and fairly simple but highly addictive farming game beginners and casual gamers can also easily learn how to play it and can just focus on the fun while making new friends.

Stardew Valley also famously has one of the most friendly and supportive online communities which makes it a perfect choice for those who struggle with communication and find it difficult to build new friendships. Since the game is also relaxing and entertaining players will be already in a good and relaxed mood before they reach out to other gamers.

12 Animal Crossing: New Horizons

Visiting Other People's Farm And Helping Them Out Makes For A Sweet Bonding Experience

An MMORPG Where Strangers Can Become Friends In Record Time

Final Fantasy 14 is one of the best choices for those gamers who are looking for an adventure-filled fantasy game and want to try a challenging MMORPG. Coordinating One's Efforts To Find The Imposter Is A Ton Of Fun

Among Us is one of the most popular asymmetrical multiplayer games with a colorful design and fun adventures. While most gamers play this game with their friends, it's also possible to find and join new crews online and play with strangers who'll surely become new virtual friends by the end of the gameplay.

Piracy Is More Fun With Friends, Especially The Ones Made In-Game

Space Dwarves And Alien Threats Combine For A Great Cooperative Experience

Befriending Survivors In Tough Situations
